oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Reminiscence about Fielding Hurst's troops in Denmark, Tennessee
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Written on the back of John Hare Bond's checks, this story recounts Fielding Hurst's harassment of West Tennessee planter Uncle Lewis "Luke" Bond. Hurst, a rare Unionist in the region, raised units of scouts and cavalry. They patrolled Federal logistical routes, chased guerillas, and skirmished with Nathan Bedford Forrest. Hurst's hard war tactics made him extremely unpopular among the locals.
